front.title: Inter-destination Media Synchronization using the RTP Control Protocol (RTCP)

abstract.t: This document gives information on an RTP Control Protocol (RTCP) Packet Type and RTCP Extended Report (XR) Block Type including associated Session Description Protocol (SDP) parameters for Inter- Destination Media Synchronization (IDMS). This document mandates the use of the RTCP XR Block Type 12, which is used to collect media playout information from participants in a group playing out (watching, listening, etc.) a specific RTP media stream. This RTCP XR Block Type is specified and registered with IANA by ETSI. The RTCP packet type specified by this document is used to distribute a common target playout point to which all the distributed receivers, sharing a media experience, can synchronize. Typical use cases in which IDMS is usefull are social TV, shared service control (i.e. applications where two or more geographically separated users are watching a media stream together), distance learning, networked video walls, networked loudspeakers, etc.
